result.execSummary:
The defendant Melinda A. Clay was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Assessment, treatment, and counseling as recommended by agent.
If revoked defendant has 35 days credit.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

superMiscConds.notes:
Any assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by PO. 

Any random testing as deemed appropriate by PO.

15CF527 - Cts. 1 and 2>>1 year MCJ on each count concurrent, w/credit for 157 days of time already served on each count; CC; DNA sample and surcharge;

State requests Restitution in 15CF527 held open for 90 days for State to contact victim (Wal-Mart) - COURT grants and holds restitution in 15CF527 open.
Defendant is eligible for CIP and SAP
